required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Thoracic Epidural Anesthesia With Different Block Level on Propofol Induction
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Thoracic Epidural Anesthesia With Different Block Level on Propofol Concentration During General Anesthesia Induction

lead_sponsor.agency: First Hospital of China Medical University

clinical_study.source: First Hospital of China Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: It is a prospective, randomized, placebo-controlled study to investigate the effect of TEA with different block level on propofol concentration during general anesthesia induction.

primary_outcome.time_frame: The participants will be followed for the duration of anesthesia induction, an expected average of half an hour
primary_outcome.description: The effect-site concentration of propofol when loss of consciousness during propofol target-controlled infusing(TCI) induction of anesthesia.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: The participants will be followed for the duration of anesthesia induction, an expected average of half an hour
secondary_outcome.description: The bispectral index (BIS) of each patient will be recorded at four different time points,as follows, baseline(the awake phase before epidural anesthesia),10 mins after epidural anesthesia, 20 mins after epidural anesthesia, loss of consciousness(when the participants are lost eyelash reflex during propofol TCI induction of anesthesia). BIS values varies from 0 to 100(0, no cerebral activity; 40 to 60, general anesthesia; 60 to 85, sedated; 85 to 100, awake).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: The participants will be followed for the duration of anesthesia induction, an expected average of half an hour
secondary_outcome.description: The mean arterial pressure of each patient will be recorded at four different time points, as follows, baseline(the awake phase before epidural anesthesia), 10 mins after epidural anesthesia, 20 mins after epidural anesthesia, loss of consciousness(when the participants are lost eyelash reflex during propofol TCI induction of anesthesia).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: The participants will be followed for the duration of anesthesia induction, an expected average of half an hour
secondary_outcome.description: The heart rate of each patient will be recorded at three different four points, as follows, baseline(the awake phase before epidural anesthesia), 10mins after epidural anesthesia, 20 mins after epidural anesthesia, loss of consciousness(when the participants are lost eyelash reflex during propofol TCI induction of anesthesia).

secondary_outcome.measure: The Block Level of Epidural Anesthesia
secondary_outcome.description: The block level 20mins after epidural anesthesia and it is verified by the loss of sensation to alcohol swab before target controlled infusion of propofol.It is the number of block segments.The block level varies from 0 to 10(0, no block level; 1 to 5, narrow block level;6 to 10, wide block level).

arm_group.description: epidural anesthesia with 1% lidocaine 10ml before propofol TCI
epidural anesthesia with 2% lidocaine 5ml before propofol TCI
epidural anesthesia with 0.9% normal saline 5ml before propofol TCI

intervention.description: epidural anesthesia with 1% lidocaine 10ml before propofol TCI
epidural anesthesia with 2% lidocaine 5ml before propofol TCI
epidural anesthesia with 0.9% normal saline 5ml before propofol TCI

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- American Society of Anesthesiologists (ASA) I-II physical status,
- aged 40-60 yr,
- BMI 19-25 kg/m2,
- undergoing elective gastrointestinal surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
- patients with cardiovascular or neurological disease, drug or alcohol abuse and absolute contraindications for neuraxial blockade.

overall_official.affiliation: Dept. of Anesthesiology, First Affiliated Hospital of China Medical University

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: First Hospital of China Medical University

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
